column2: WASHINGTON PERMIT TEST
column4: Washington
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a narrow road ahead.

column2: 2. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: round.
column6: regulatory signs.
column8: rectangle shaped.

column2: 3. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column6: Yield.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 4. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column6: indicate reserved lanes.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: is a warning sign.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column10: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 6. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: less dangerous
column6: darker
column8: narrower and shorter

column2: 7. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 8. This road sign is:
column4: a guide sign.
column6: a warning sign.
column8: a regulatory sign.

column2: 9. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)

column2: 10. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Listen to heavy metal music.

column2: 11. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 12. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 13. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: exclusively for stop signs.
column8: for yeild signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 14. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column10: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 15. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.

column2: 16. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: reserved for blind people.
column6: directly behind them.
column8: on the right.

column2: 17. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column4: sharp turn
column6: no left turn
column8: no sharp turn

column2: 18. If you see side-by-side red lights flashing at a railroad crossing, you must:
column4: maintain your current speed and cross the railroad.
column6: slow down and proceed with caution.
column8: stop.
column10: make a left turn after crossing the railroad.

column2: 19. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Drinking coffee.

column2: 20. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: reduce the reaction distance.
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 21. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column6: look toward the left side of the road.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 22. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: there are four stop signs at this intersection.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: No passing zone ahead.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 24. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Slower vehicles must keep left.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 25. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: On slippery roads.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 26. When driving on a road with two lanes traveling in opposite directions:
column4: you should use the left lane except when legally passing another vehicle.
column6: you may use the left lane if you’re going to turn left.
column8: you should use the right lane except when legally passing another vehicle.
column10: you may drive in either lane.

column2: 27. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles are slower than cars.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column10: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 28. This sign indicates:
column4: Phone service ahead
column6: Emergency line available
column8: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column6: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: No traffic signal ahead

column2: 30. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They always have the right-of-way.
column6: They obey specific traffic laws.
column8: They don’t have rearview mirrors.
column10: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 31. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: ignore them completely.
column6: pump your brakes to get them to back off.
column8: speed up to increase the space between you and the tailgater.
column10: slow down to encourage the tailgater to pass.

column2: 32. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: park in the zoo area.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 33. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: make a U-turn.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.

column2: 34. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: All of the above.
column10: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 35. When entering highway from private road, drivers should:
column4: turn on their emergency flashers to alert other drivers.
column6: yield to all vehicles approaching on the roadway.
column8: only yield to the vehicle on their right.
column10: only yield to the vehicle on their left.

column2: 36. The inside temperature of a vehicle can rise almost __ degrees within the first __ minutes with no ventilation.
37. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column6: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column10: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.

column2: 38. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: None of the above.
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 39. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Do not enter.
column8: Wrong way.

column2: 40. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Construction warning.
column6: Stop.
column8: Railroad crossing.
